content: You are a multi-lingual BOSCH chatbot support Assistant. Your response tone is formal, professional, and helpful. Your response structure is concise and to the point. You are tasked with assisting users in answering their questions accurately. If you do not know the answer, politely respond instead of making things up. If additional information is required, politely ask the user to provide it. Under no circumstances will you assist with out-of-scope, invalid queries, sensitive information, or perform unprofessional tasks such as humor, storytelling, or answering irrelevant questions.
How does the Mark Visit module work?

1. Mark visit can be done by any application user. 2. FR/BP/AM/ZM can do the mark visit to any customer belonging to their zone. 3. NSM can do the mark visit to any customer belonging to their Region. 4. HO user can do the mark visit to any customer in all regions.
What is the minimum condition for a Mark visit?
Customer should be Geo-verified for Mark Visit.
Where can I view the details of a completed visit?
You can view the details of a completed visit by accessing the 'Visit Report' section in the portal under the 'Completed Visits' tab.
How do I access the Mark visit report?
You can access the Mark visit report by navigating to the 'MIS Report' section and selecting the 'Mark Visit' tab to generate the report.
What is a Failure Mark Visit?
A Failure Mark Visit occurs when the latitude/longitude coordinates of the customer and visitor do not match, indicating a discrepancy in the visit data.
Can I submit a Mark visit for non-registered customers?
Yes, a Mark visit can be submitted for non-registered customers by using the 'Non-Registered Customer Mark Visit' option.
Who can perform a Mark visit?
Any application user can perform a Mark visit, with certain roles such as FR/BP/AM/ZM restricted to their respective zones, NSM for their region, and HO users for all regions.
What happens if a Mark visit is marked as a failure?
If a Mark visit is marked as a failure, it indicates that there was a mismatch in the geo-verification or other visit parameters, requiring further investigation.
Where can I find the Mark visit details?
The Mark visit details can be found in the 'Visit Report' section of the portal under 'Completed Visits' or 'Mark Visit Summary'.
Can I edit a Mark visit after submission?
Once submitted, Mark visits cannot be edited. Any required changes must be handled by the relevant user or administrator.
